definition: lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
surname San
three/3
residence
old variant of 捨|舍[she3]
surname She
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: He says prospective fathers-in-law are put off by his career.
sentences.chinese: 他说女孩子的父亲都因他的事业对他退避三舍。

sentences.english: Wisdom consists in learning when to evade and when to oppose head-on.
sentences.chinese: 明智在于懂得何时应退避三舍，何时应迎难而上。

sentences.english: People avoided him, but the dogs hung out with him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然人们都对他退避三舍，但是狗却乐于和他结伴。

sentences.english: The annoying habits and bad character traits seem to recede into the background.
sentences.chinese: 原来那些令人讨厌的习惯和坏脾气似乎都退避三舍。

definition: to withdraw
to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
panic-stricken
to keep quiet out of fear (idiom)
to flee in defeat/to bolt
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
to provoke/to tease
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to feel intimidated
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
intimidate at the first glance (idiom); awe-inspiring/terrifying/overwhelming
to overawe/to be scared into submission
